summary: Skilled Financial Accountant with a demonstrated history and adaptability to changes. Experienced in Analytical Skills, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Spanish, Microsoft Word/Excel, and Management. Strong accounting professional with a B.S. focused on Accounting from Bentley University and a M.B.A graduate from Northeastern University with a focus on International Business.

education.field_of_study: Accouting and Minor in Business Law

profile_positions.description:
-Coordinate review of annual and semiannual financial statements, and quarterly schedule of portfolio holdings for registered funds, hedge funds (onshore and offshore) and Australian/Irish domiciled funds.
-Collaborate with internal groups (e.g. Tax, Portfolio Operations, Legal, etc.) on Confirmation letters, Legal letters and additional audit related or representation letters.
 -Work hand in hand with internal and external teams to meet our regulatory filling deadlines, including SEC, CFTC and NFA reports and filings.
 -Interface with the funds’ auditors to resolve issues including accounting positions taken and valuation matters.
 -Research and document accounting and/or disclosure matters to develop technically supportable, yet implementable, positions.
 -Research and implement new accounting and reporting rules as applicable.
 -Collaborate with fund administrators to ensure funds’ accounting positions and policies are properly executed and presented in the accounting records.
 -Perform review of various disclosure documents including prospectuses, SAIs, PPMs, offering documents, etc.
-Work closely with the lead public and private fund financial reporting managers to assist in carrying-out day-to-day tasks.
profile_positions.title: Financial Reporting Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Lead and planned communication with clients, internal groups and auditors daily, while ensuring issues and requests are addressed timely and to the correct party. Ensuring all partied attained an agenda and all points were covered efficiently.
- Prepare financial statements for annual, semi-annual and quarterly shareholder reports for RIC, Business Development Companies (BDC's), and Alternative Investment vehicles.
- Extensive experience with REITS and other Real Estate Investments.
- Assisted with the coordination of SEC filings for large group of funds with monthly filings.
- IT transformations of databases. Automated new and existing clients from excel plataforms to controlled system (automated Plataforms).
- Reviewed and prepared expense invoices, monthly budgets, accruals, monthly advisory fees, and monitored expenses caps.
- Calculated and prepared excise distributions
- Performed /IRS testing and asset diversification test to ensure compliance
- Reviewed compliance matrices against prospectus and SAI for annual compliance reviews
profile_positions.title: Fund Manager, Senior Associate

profile_positions.description:
•	Assisted in the planning and performance of annual financial statement audits in accordance with Generally Accepted Auditing Standards, working with teams ranging from  2-3 associates to teams of 60 plus, and ensured clients adhered to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles. 
•	Investment fund expertise includes domestic, bond, money market, indexed, allocation & specialized mutual funds and private equity partnership funds (audit exposure to over 120 funds)
•	Developed relationships and worked directly with key client contacts, including financial reporting and fund accounting staff
•	Reviewed and evaluated clients’ control environment through review of SSAE 16 reports and documented findings
•	Performed cohesively in team environment throughout the execution of the audit, ensuring appropriate testing is conducted for the issuance of an opinion
•	Presented research and supported resolutions for managers and partners on technical accounting issues noted
•	Prepared and reviewed various analyses related to financial statement balances, various sources of income and expenses, investment returns and other metrics
•	Evaluated the accounting of various partnership relationships including waterfall calculations, management fee calculations, performance calculations, and allocations to partners
•	Worked on a full benefit plan audit for a large corporation and smaller assignments auditing form 5500 tax filings for benefit plan funds
•	Worked on a higher education engagement, gaining some experience in a new industry
•	Stayed active in firm campus recruiting activities, assisted with multiple career fairs, prospective office visits, and professional organization events

COMPUTER SKILLS:
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, Bloomberg, and Lotus Notes; basic knowledge of ORACLE
